thread.title: Pics: DJR Team Penske’s 2017 livery revealed
thread.title_full: Pics: DJR Team Penske’s 2017 livery revealed

title: Pics: DJR Team Penske’s 2017 livery revealed
text:
Supercars: DJR Team Penske reveals Shell V-Power livery for 2017 season Staff writers, FOX SPORTS February 7, 2017 1:37pm 
DJR Team Penske has unveiled colours their Ford Falcons will race in during the 2017 Virgin Australia Supercars Championship. 
Fabian Coulthard and new teammate Scott McLaughlin, along with their Pirtek Enduro Cup co-drivers Tony D’Alberto and Alex Premat, did the honours outside Etihad Stadium, a literal stone’s throw from Shell’s Australian base in Melbourne. 
The overall livery is a refinement of last year’s Shell V-Power livery, except the company’s pecten logo takes pride of place on a red bonnet, as well as switching out its Helix oil brand for V-Power premium petrol. 
This year will see the team race the full season in Shell colours, the squad adopting the ‘Shell V-Power Racing Team’ name as a sign of the increased commitment from Viva Energy, exclusive licensees of the Shell brand in Australia. media_camera Premat and McLaughlin with their new-look car. 
“This is a very exciting time for Viva Energy and Shell in Australia,” Viva Energy’s general manager consumer, Dan Ridgway, said. 
“We have had a partnership with DJR Team Penske for many years, but our commitment to the Shell V-Power brand as the naming right platform for this program opens up new and innovative programs on track and at 920+ service stations across the country. media_camera Premat, McLaughlin, D’Alberto and Coulthard with the new livery. 
“We strive to deliver efficiency and performance with our fuel and lubricant products and we have delivered substantial improvements through our technical alliance with DJR Team Penske. media_camera The livery was revealed in the shadows of Etihad Stadium, right in front of Shell’s Australian HQ. 
“Shell has a long tradition of taking what is learned from the track and transferring that knowledge intohigh quality products. The Shell V-Power Racing Team will be at the forefront of this program.” 
The new-look cars will race for the first time at the Clipsal 500 Adelaide on March 2-5. media_camera Scott McLaughlin with the new DJR Team Penske Ford Falcon. media_camera
